ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow

Class SerialClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.roboticsLab.yellow.SerialClient

  • public class SerialClient
extends java.lang.Object

    This class connects to a Yellow robot server and offers methods to read and write messages to and from the robot.

    The class also offers static methods to parse Yellow telemetry messages and create the corresponding Java Telemetry objects.

    The class spanws a private thread that reads incoming telemetry messages as they arrive. A call to method receive() will return immediately with the latest Telemetry message received. Hence the call is non blocking but the Telemetry message returned may be old. Use the Telemetry.timestamp entry to check this.

    Usage example: 

     try {
   // Connect to a Yellow robot
   SerialClient robot = SerialClient.getInstance();
   // Get the latest incoming message
   Telemetry telemetry = robot.receive();
   System.out.println("Got telemetry:\n" + telemetry);
 
   // Send a command
   robot.set("state { stateName: OFF }");
 
   // Disconnect from the robot
   robot = null;
 } catch (Exception e) {
   e.printStackTrace();
   System.exit(0);
 }

    To see debuging log console messages start with 

    -Dyellow.debug=true

    Author:
    gabriel.gruener@bfh.ch
    See Also:
    Telemetry, yellow.proto

      • receive

        public Telemetry receive()
        Retrieve the last incoming message from the robot. This method returns immediately with the latest message received from the robot.
        Returns:
        Telemetry object holding the incoming message.

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String telecommand)
        Appends the given telecommand to the queue.
        Parameters:
        telecommand - The telecommand to append in protobuf UTF-8 text json format.

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String telecommand)
        Sets the given telecommand at the front of the queue, removing any remaining commands from the queue.
        Parameters:
        telecommand - The telecommand to send in protobuf UTF-8 text json format.

      • parseFromFile

        public static Telemetry parseFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Parse a telemetry message in text form from file. This method is useful to test functionality without robot communication.
        Parameters:
        filename - Path to the file to read the message from.
        Returns:
        Telemetry object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error happens while parsing the message.
